faqs.question: Wie viel kostet diese Immobilie?
faqs.answer: €558,000. This represents €2,502 per square meter for a 223-square-meter property on a 13,172-square-meter plot—approximately 40% less than comparable properties in Spanish island markets. faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca ein guter Ort zum Immobilienkauf?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca consistently delivers strong investment fundamentals: proven appreciation rates, established expatriate communities, excellent infrastructure, and Mediterranean lifestyle at competitive European pricing. Aspe particularly attracts sophisticated buyers seeking inland tranquility with coastal accessibility and demonstrated 8% year-on-year market growth.

faqs.question: Können Ausländer Immobilien in Spanien kaufen?
faqs.answer: Yes. EU citizens and most international buyers can purchase Spanish property without restrictions. Spain actively welcomes foreign investment through Non-Lucrative Visas, Digital Nomad Visas, and standard residency provisions. Professional legal guidance ensures proper title transfer, tax compliance, and documentation—typically handled efficiently through Spanish notaries.

faqs.question: Welche Kosten fallen beim Immobilienkauf in Spanien an?
faqs.answer: Beyond purchase price, budget approximately 10-12% additional costs: 6-8% transfer tax (impuesto de transmisiones), notary fees (€800-1,500), registry fees (€300-600), and legal representation (€1,500-3,000). Some regions offer tax reductions for first-time international buyers. These represent standard EU property acquisition costs, lower than many English-speaking jurisdictions.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Grundsteuern in Spanien?
faqs.answer: Die jährlichen Grundsteuern (IBI) average 0.4-0.6% of cadastral value—typically 40-60% below market value. For this €558,000 property, expect approximately €1,200-1,800 annual IBI. Rental income from property generates taxable revenue at progressive rates (19-45% depending on total income), though non-residents benefit from simplified tax regimes under specific conditions.

faqs.question: Kann ich als Ausländer eine Hypothek in Spanien bekommen?
faqs.answer: Yes. Spanish banks offer mortgages to non-residents, typically covering 60-80% of purchase value at competitive rates. Interest rates approximate 3-4% for 20-30 year terms. EU citizens receive standard lending terms; non-EU buyers may require NIE (tax identification) numbers and proof of income. Major banks (Banco Santander, BBVA, CaixaBank) actively support international lending.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Lebenshaltungskosten an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca's cost of living remains 20-30% lower than northern Europe: groceries cost approximately 30-40% less, restaurant meals €10-15 for quality dining, utilities €100-150 monthly for modern properties, and healthcare costs 50% below UK/US pricing. This affordability extends quality lifestyle to expatriate residents with modest budgets.

faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca gut für Rentner?
faqs.answer: Excellent. Costa Blanca attracts thousands of retirees, particularly British and Scandinavian residents, drawn by Mediterranean climate, low cost of living, excellent healthcare at minimal cost, established expatriate communities, and lifestyle quality. Non-Lucrative Visa provisions specifically target retirees with modest pension income, offering tax-efficient residency for €28,000+ annual non-Spanish income.

faqs.question: Wie weit ist die Costa Blanca von Deutschland entfernt?
faqs.answer: Alicante Airport operates direct flights to most UK cities (London, Manchester, Birmingham, Glasgow) with journey times of 2-2.5 hours. Ryanair, EasyJet, and scheduled carriers provide frequent, affordable connections. Ferry options via France require 24-30 hours but appeal to those transporting vehicles. The accessibility enables regular UK contact while maintaining Spanish residency.

faqs.question: Wie ist das Wetter an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Mediterranean climate delivers 320+ sunshine days annually with average temperatures 16°C (winter) to 28°C (summer). Rainfall concentrates in autumn/spring months; summer drought characterizes typical Mediterranean patterns. Inland Aspe experiences slightly cooler summers and milder winters than coastal areas—ideal for those preferring temperate conditions without extreme heat or cold.
